links.title: Stocks making the biggest moves premarket: BLK, DAL, GE, BBBY, WMT, GSK, LMT & more
links.description: Spencer Platt | Getty Images Check out the companies making headlines before the bell: BlackRock - The asset management firm reported adjusted quarterly profit of $6.70 per share, beating the consensus estimate of $6.39, with revenue also above forecasts. Profit was up nearly 27 percent from a year earlier, helped by a lower tax rate and an increase in advisory fees.

message.body: $AAPL Apple shipments declined in Q1 as PC sales were flat across the board compared to the prior year. https://stocknews.com/news/aapl-apple-inc-aapl-pc-shipments-slump-along-with-rest-of/

links.title: Apple Inc. (AAPL) PC Shipments Slump Along With Rest Of Industry
links.description: Overall PC sales were flat in Q1, and Apple Inc's (NASDAQ:AAPL) shipments declined as a result. The tech giant's share of the market dipped slightly as its shipments dropped by 4.8 percent for the quarter. Marketwatch has the news on the tough start to the year for Apple's computer arm.

links.title: An ETF For The Future Of Tech (NASDAQ:XT)
links.description: Traditional technology sector exchange-traded funds usually follow a similar model. That model being large weights to the likes of Apple Inc. (NASDAQ: AAPL), Microsoft Corporation (NASDAQ: MSFT), Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ: GOOGL) and other massive tech titans. Some newer technology ETFs are taking different approaches, evolving with tech investing as the sector itself evolves.

links.title: Apple Inc. (AAPL) HomePod Sales Are Floundering
links.description: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) entered a crowded smart speaker space earlier this year with big ambitions. Its high-priced HomePod, with luxurious sound and built-in Siri support, appeared set to redefine the market.
